settings.title: Equine Medicine Elevated.
settings.text:
CannaHorse is a global leader in the research and development of cannabinoid-based
therapies for horses.

settings.title: Pets & Cannabis
settings.text:
A number of clinical trials for dogs and cats have
been completed. These studies have shown success
in treating similar ailments to humans such as pain
and arthritis, seizures, and anxiety.

settings.title: Equestrians of Cannabis
settings.text:
We believe in the power of plant-based medicine for humans and how that can extend to our horses. In our ongoing series Equestrians of Cannabis we profile how the plant has helped the lives of horse people around the world.

If your life has been improved with cannabis, we'd love to share your story.

settings.text:
Read our Education section to learn about cannabinoids, terpenes and how the endocannabioid system works.

Don't worry, we'll tell you what those words mean too.

settings.title: Athletes & Cannabis
settings.text: Athletes are seeing the benefits of cannabinoids for everyday health, training and competition recovery. Early trials in animals such as dogs and even horses seem to be showing the same benefits as humans.

settings.title: How CannaHorse Can Help Your Horse
settings.text: We take cannabis seriously. Learn how CannaHorse is different from our commitment to research, pharmaceutical grade ingredients, science based formulations and precise and efficient dosing.

settings.faq_answer: Cannabis has been proven to have a safety profile unmatched by most pharmaceuticals. See our education section for more safety information.

settings.faq_question: What's the difference between Cannabis, Hemp and Marijuana?
settings.faq_answer: Cannabis is the general term used for all species of Cannabis Sativa. Hemp is used to describe varieties/strains/cultivars of the plant that contain less than 0.3% THC. Marijuana is an American term for varieties of cannabis with higher levels of THC.
No. CannaHorse products do not contain levels of THC to have an intoxicating effect.

settings.faq_question: What's the difference between CBD and THC?
settings.faq_answer: CBD (Cannabidiol) and THC (Tetrahydrocannabinol) are the two most common cannabinoids found in the cannabis plant. For more information about cannabinoids visit our education section.

settings.faq_question: Can I use your products in competition?
settings.faq_answer:
No.

Cannabinoids including THC and CBD are banned from international competition and most national federations as well. 

We cannot yet give an accurate guideline on withdrawal, but in some cases in humans, phytocannabinoids can stay in the body for 30-45 days +.

settings.title: Equestrians of Cannabis
settings.text: More and more equestrians are turning to plant based medicines. Here are some of their stories.

settings.cta_text: If your life has been improved by cannabis, we'd love to share your story.

settings.heading: Plant Powered
settings.content: We believe in the power of plant-based medicine for humans and how that can extend to our horses. In our ongoing series Equestrians of Cannabis we profile how the plant has helped the lives of horse people around the world.

settings.feature_row_content:
EQUILIBRIUM ORAL is scientifically formulated to provide a customized hemp solution to support a well-balanced metabolic, immune, and wellness profile in your horse. The dosage is selected based on our research to provide optimum blood concentrations when consumed orally.

COMING SOON

settings.blog_banner_subtitle: Find research studies, educational materials and book consultations to learn how you can incorporate cannabinoid based therapy in your practice or equine facility.

settings.block_content:
Strainprint maintains the world's largest dataset on medical cannabis use in humans. Strainprint helps medical cannabis patients and doctors to use cannabis in the most effective and responsible way possible.

The data collected by Strainprint is used to guide doctors and patients to specific cannabis products, in order to treat specific ailments, based on cannabinoid and terpene formulas.

CannaHorse uses this data to determine the cannabinoid and terpene content and ratios for our product lines.

Biopharm is one of Europe's leading contract research organizations, based just outside Prague in the Czech Republic.

Biopharm received approval from the Czech Ministry of Health to conduct CannaHorse's initial pharmacokinetic, bioavailability and behavioural studies. These were among the first ever licenses by a federal government for invasive trials of cannabis on animals in Europe.

Bimeda is an Irish animal pharmaceutical manufacturer with manufacturing operations on 5 continents and sales to 75 countries. Based in Chicago, Bimeda manufacture leading equine products including Polyglycan and ConfidenceEQ among a number of anti-parasitic drugs, vaccines and others.

Bimeda aid CannaHorse in research, manufacturing and distribution strategy.
An experienced owner, breeder, and buyer of thoroughbred champions, whose marketing clients have included EquiLottery, the RCMP, and BBC Films.
Cannabis industry expert with 150+ products launched into regulated markets and provincial dressage champion.
Head of Equine Science at Murray State University with world-leading equine cannabis knowledge.
Former CitiBank Investment Banker and insurance executive, horse owner and amateur polo player.

settings.row_one_content:
CannaHorse was founded with the goal of bringing the medicinal properties of the cannabis plant to horses. As more jurisdictions allow veterinarians access to cannabis and hemp-derived health products, vets and horse owners are seeking quality, scientifically proven products.

Traditional overprescribed pharmaceutical products can lead to negative side effects for horses and their owners, which is why more horse owners are seeking healthier alternatives.

Cannahorse’s world-leading team of cannabis and veterinary research institutions includes universities and equine research professionals focused on proving efficacy and safety for their product formulations.
settings.three_col_title: CannaHorse products are developed with the following principles in mind:

settings.section_content: The Endocannabinoid System (ECS) is a vital molecular system in the body of all mammals that helps to maintain homeostasis, in other words the ECS helps your body stay in the Goldilocks Zone.
settings.col_one_content: Receptors are situated within the central nervous system
settings.col_two_content: CB2 endocannabinoid receptors are found in the peripheral system, such as within immune cells
settings.col_two_listing:
CARDIOVASCULAR SYSTEM

CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM

BONE | EYES | GUT

IMMUNE SYSTEM

KIDNEYS | LIVER | PANCREAS

MUSCLE | SKIN | TUMORS

settings.title: Equine Professionals
settings.text:
Cannabis medicine is new, we're here to help educate veterinarians, equine health professionals, and stable owners and managers.

Book a 20-30 min consultation via Zoom at the button below. We can help you fit cannabinoid therapy into your equine healthcare routine.

settings.blog_banner_subtitle: Thank you for registering your account.
